title.narrative: Supporting PACU Strategy: Strengthened Cooperative Movement

description.narrative: The project aims at strengthening the agricultural coops and rural development in general ‎through strengthening PACU’s capacities in providing collective services for its members, thus, the ‎member coop societies are strengthened to address the needs and rights of their members and ‎communities. Also, this project will promote gender equality through advocacy campaigns and promoting women participation and focus on women entrepreneurship ‎components. Results:‎ • Strengthened organisational Capacities of PACU and its member coops through increased ‎membership of the agricultural coops.‎ • Upgrading and implementing the M&E system.‎ • Increased business capacity of PACU and its members through providing business development ‎services and updating and implementing PACU’s annual business plan. ‎ • Improved service delivery to member coops by facilitating collective purchases and creating ‎marketing channels for member coops. ‎ • Improved agricultural sustainable production by advocating and supporting Good Agricultural ‎Practices and quality standards to members and improving the quality of the cooperative ‎members’ products.‎ • Promoted women equal rights of access to economic opportunities and participation at PACU and ‎its members by: ‎ - the FRAS system to measure fair resource allocation (50% to women) - Increasing women members' participation in the coops ‎ - Women empowerment trainings in leadership and management skills.‎ - Promoting and advocating for women’s rights and gender equality (advocacy campaign)‎
The project was frozen due to resignation of all staff in April, therefore inability to implement project. No activities were implemented for 2018.
